user.description: Configure HA Predictions integration. Select a target entity to predict and feature entities to use for prediction.

data_description.CONF_FEATURE_ENTITY: What are good feature entities? Feature entities should have a strong correlation with the target entity you want to predict. For example, if you want to predict the state of a light based on motion sensors and time of day, you would select motion sensors and a time-based entity as feature entities. It may help to reduce the resolution of time-based entities by providing a template sensor that only contains the first digit of minutes (e.g., 10:15 becomes 10:1).

error.target_entity_not_found: Target entity does not exist in your Home Assistant instance.
error.target_entity_wrong_domain: Target entity must be a light, switch, or input_boolean.
error.feature_entity_not_found: One or more feature entities do not exist in your Home Assistant instance.

init.description: Update feature entities for prediction. Note: Changing feature entities will reset your training data.
